page.title: 06HORTICULTURE,CASTLETOWN
page.content: The Garden Centre,owned by Mrs.Speed,began from two boxes of bedding plants left over when her own garden was full. Over the last two years it has expanded,now having two new green- houses,car park and sand beds.Mrs Speed tries to sell all the things gardeners in Caithness might need, from vegetable seeds/plants to vases. Mrs Speed overcomes the lack of daylight in Caithness,in Spring,by using a light-cabinet,in which she simulates East Anglian daylight to give her seedlings an early start. The Garden Centre is open all year, and Mrs Speed enjoys her work, providing her fifty to sixty customers per day with seeds,bedding plants, shrubs,weedkillers,pesticides,tools etc.and her own good advice and help.
